Projects

September 22, 2019

Here’s some of the stuff I’ve written:

  • vim-zen: Barebones Vim plugin manager
  • vim-githubinator: Show selected text in Vim on Github
  • vim-yami: Monochromatic dark(闇) theme for Vim
  • vimport: Vim plugin to import and drop modules
  • goodreadsh: Command line interface for goodreads.com
  • pip-name: Check whether a package name is available on PyPi
  • amizone-cli: Command line interface for amizone.net
  • chromatic: Create monochromatic backgrounds on the terminal
  • py-splice: A Python interface to splice(2) syscall
  • dash: Unix shell written with piping & history recollection
  • githubfs: Read-only virtual file-system for Github using FUSE
  • Vim Tricks: Amazon Alexa skill that helps you learn new vim tricks
  • Chapelle Wisdom: Amazon Alexa skill that uplift your mood


Dotfiles

I’m “passionate” about my setup, It has equal amounts of aesthetics and efficiency. I’d love to talk more about it but this is not the right place, maybe a post of it’s own someday. Until then, check out the repo.

editor      : nvim
colorscheme : vim-yami
terminal    : iTerm2
font        : Fira Mono
mux         : tmux
shell       : zsh
os          : macOS

That’s about it, feel free to reach out.
